text: I had the Montgomery Monster burger and it was amazing! My wife had the smaller burger and a cupcake and loved it all. Definitely worth searching them out.

My Mom enjoyed her veggie dog, too. The staff is wonderful. Definitely recommend. Thank you!

We stopped here on our way home. I’ve never tried it until then but I can say I never will again! Atleast not this location!!
First and for most the employees were arguing in front of customers when I first walked in.
Second, my food tastes HORRIBLE! Like the refrigeration wasn’t running very well on where they keep the meats. Third, whip I was eating the sandwich I send a FREAKING ROACH CRAWLING ON THE WALL.
I tried to get the manager but she was “busy”, all the employee would tell me is her name was ranni ? I tried to call her after we left to inform her of our stop and hopefully get these situations explained and fixed! Never got a call back.

name: Duncan Mills
text:
Honestly it just all around sucked.

The line/checkout was confusing, I did not know where to pay or wait for my food. My sub wasn’t made right in front of me like literally every other sub sandwich place. They got it served through the window then I got asked “what you want?” And they peel open your sandwich to add ingredients.

The food, albeit edible for a hungry shift worker, was pretty sad. All I wanted was a normal BLT sub sandwich with mayo, and some chips. Instead, I got served this weird but sad triple-decker pressed Texas toast BLT. I didn’t mind the non traditional approach, but the execution was bad. The Texas toast was smashed so thin I had this dense layer of mayonaise soaked bread to peel off my teeth. The bacon was cooked well but the lack of lettuce, tomato, and a normal sub bun kinda ruined it.

At least it was cheap, around $7.50, so at least it wasn’t an expensive mistake.

You would think for being a "Sub" shop a philly cheese steak would be a strong point but I was sadly mistaken. If you want a better meal for a better price I'd advise you taking your money anywhere else but here.

text: Miss Paula's new sourdough flat top sandwiches are UNBELIEVABLE. She has chicken salad , tuna salad, ham and cheese, fried bologna and grilled cheese. The tuna salad is wonderful .No strong fish taste. Don't know how she did that??  The chicken salad puts chappys and chicken salad chicks to shame and it's way cheaper. So ladies and gentlemen please check her out. Oh by the way her dogs and coleslaw are the best in the river region. Southern slaw dog with mustard pure heaven!!

text:
Gus’s Hot Dogs is a Crestline Classic. Not only do they have great customer service, but phenomenal food that makes you feel at a local diner. I suggest you go before noon and get a sausage, egg, and cheese biscuit(they are sincerely the best you will ever have, I’ve been here for years and they’ve only messed it up once or twice). Obviously there is room for human error but they are nice people and happy to help. Anyone that dislikes Gus’s is either a competitor or stupid.

Also Jay Carter’s review on this place is beyond parody, he’s obviously pusillanimous and can’t handle himself, sorry you’re so weak bro hit the gym.

The whole place was spotless. A friendly police officer watched me as I left and probably wondered why I waddled out. No, on second thought, he knew.
Will go on my lunch location routine.

name: judy Collins
text: we enjoyed the meal.  What i didnt enjoy is what happens all to often on any and all jobs. The young girl who takes the orders, also does the stock, cleans the tables, and sweeps the floors, she was swamped with work to do  and asked the older man behind the counter, that puts the burgers together, for help in taking the orders.  He acted as though it was a real problem for him to work the register and help the young girl out.  I understand the jobs, but there is a time that you just pitch in!!  If i was that manager at that store, the older man would be sweeping the floors and wiping down tables.  The black lady that did the cooking was just as much as a jerk as the older man.   She had an attitude a mile long.  Other than that the service from the young cashier was great she was very friendly and nice.  Did a wonderful job.  there should be 2 cashiers working.  The burgers and fries were great.

name: Spencer Plasse
text:
Visited yesterday for the first time. It’s an off the beaten path style restaurant and did not disappoint by any means.

I was very impressed by the burger. It was perfectly cooked and the sauce added a lot to it. The fries were very crispy and had just the right amount of salt. Their sweet tea was also great.

I also tried a peach milkshake, which was pretty decent. The service is fantastic and the prices are average. I would highly recommend it to anyone. It’s well worth any drive!

Off the beaten path hamburger joint.
Has that ma and pa feel to it at least the location I went to in Gardendale.  The hamburger patties are thick and juicy even the sliders are not to be underestimated.
Craving a huge homemade style burger try the Holy Cow burger with thick cut fries or thick cut sweet potatoe fries my personal fav.  Lastly they have the best banana pudding just like my  grandma used to make delish.  Highly recommend if in the area.

I ordered 4 chicken tenders & fries last week. Allena M, took care of me.
When I arrived home, the tenders was so HARD & BURNT, my dog even
refused to eat it.  I was so disappointed! They must have new management, that doesn't care.  I paid $10.76.  My last time there. I went to Pulblix the next day, & ordered chicken tenders. It was so much better.

Good luck on your nasty tenders & deceiving people with a smile!

name: Jeremiah Johnson
text:
I generally give positive reviews for my dining experiences, but this Hamburger Heaven in Gardendale broke my culinary cherry! The food was fine but the customer service was despicable. We experienced good service from our drive thru cashier. She was nice and pleasant; but when my wife realized that she was missing her fork and dressing for her hamburger salad; that's when it all went haywire.

She pulled around to go inside and when she encountered the manager about the mistake, he first questioned her about whether she had a salad or not and when she wanted the dressing as well to eat the salad with he made her feel like a common thief! It was like, because we are  minorities, a 1960's lunch counter uprising. The manager should be ashamed of themselves. Customer service is an art form and this person made our otherwise good experience a bad one.

resp.text: Hi, Jeremiah. My name is Allen Folse, and I am the owner of Hamburger Heaven Gardendale. I was the one who spoke with your wife today. I did ask if she ordered a salad but only because it is our practice to make sure a dressing is included in every salad and I wanted to make sure I addressed the oversight with my employees so that it didn’t happen again. I apologize for any misunderstanding that may have caused and invite you to give me a call at the restaurant if you would like to discuss any of your concerns. We value each and every one of our customers and hope to see you again soon.

name: Amber Allen
text: I absolutely LOVE this Place.. only This Hamburger Heaven here in Gardendale,  has never failed me. The budgets are thick and very good!!! No thin patties here... KEEP UP THE GREAT JOB GUYS!!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Ragan. While I can assure you that our grease is changed regularly, it sounds like your experience was not up to our standards. I would like the chance to make it up to you. You can call the restaurant and ask for Allen Folse or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com.

name: joe richardson
text: I was disappointed to find out that they was drive-thru service only. I was supposed to meet a family from Kentucky there and had to find another place to meet them and eat at the last minute.

resp.text: Joe - We are sorry that you were disappointed. We have signage outside the restaurant and on social media alerting our customers that our dining room is closed or has limited hours due to ongoing challenges caused by the pandemic and its effects on staffing and operations for our restaurant and many others. We appreciate your patience as we navigate this unprecedented event and apologize for any inconvenience our limited dining room hours have caused. We hope you will gives us another chance in the future.

name: Tamera Crawford
text: I came to hamburger heaven on a Tuesday night about 6:45, so I know it’s a rush for dinner. if you’ve been through the drive-thru at the hamburger heaven in Gardendale, you know that from the menu to the checkout window you can see the person taking your order. When I was giving my order for my whole family, anytime I added anything else this young man Taking my orders seemed to throw his hands around and roll his eyes as if it bothered him I was getting more than one thing. I noticed when I moved up one car length at a time through the drive-thru, i noticed he seem to be doing this with everyone, not just me. As I got up to the window he let me sit at the window for about five minutes with the line backed all the way up before he even had the drinks ready like usual or my order paid for just standing at the screen taking orders… but the line wasn’t moving. While the food has always been good here for me, service is more important. It turns out this is the owner son, Nick, who is so bothered by taking orders to the drive-thru. After I sat at the window waiting for him to take my card to pay for my meal for about 5 to 6 minutes, Allena(I assume was her name, it was on my receipt the lady handed me)  finally came to the window, gave me my food, and helped clear out the drive-through line because it seemed like Nick wasn’t doing anything. I could hear him cursing and see him throwing his hands around anytime more than one thing was added to an order if he were to say “is there anything else?” not to mention my meals were cheeseburgers with everything but pickles onion and tomato, and i got plain burgers with ONLY pickles onions and tomatoes..👍🏻Maybe it seems like because he’s the owner son he can act how he wants… That doesn’t get you very good service reviews and I most likely will not be back to this location, Because while the food can be great, the service still means more.

resp.text:
Tamera,

Thank you for letting me know about your experience. Please accept my apology for the behavior you witnessed and know that it is out of character. While there is no excuse, our store did have an unexpected volume of business this evening due to the devastating effects of last night's tornado on our neighboring restaurants in Fultondale.

Unfortunately, this proved to be a frustrating challenge for a teenager still learning to handle high stress situations. Rest assured, this will be a learning experience for him.

I value your business and want every customer to feel as if they are treated with respect when they visit our restaurant. I would like to make this right and compensate you for your meal. Please call me at 205-531-8766 or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com. Again, thank you for your feedback and bringing this to my attention.

- Allen Folse

name: mandy page
text: They didn't get my order right at all. The food is ok.

resp.text: Mandy - We would like the opportunity to address your concerns and make up for your incorrect order. Please email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com or call 205-631-1339 if you would like to discuss your experience.

name: Dez Brown
text: The past two times I've been here within the past week my order was messed up each time!! The first time 9/22/20 my two burgers were so burnt that the cook that day tried to cover it up with melted cheese and tons of sauce. I had to throw away about $10 worth of food bc it was too burnt to eat. All you could taste was burnt hamburger meat that was hard as a rock. My family and I decided to give them another try tonight 9/26/20 the cook left off my bacon that I ordered with my burger. So I went back to the restaurant and explained what was going on to the sweet older woman at the register. She had the cooks remake my burger again. I got back out to the car only to discover that the cook screwed up by burger yet again!!! This time by giving me a completely different burger than what I ordered. I did not take it back a third time bc I was dealing with a cranky toddler and was just beyond frustrated with the cooks. They need to get better cooks or properly train their cooks.

resp.text: We are sorry that you did not enjoy your experience and would like the opportunity to address your concerns! Please give us a call at 205-631-1339 and ask for Allen or send an email to allenfolse@bellsouth.net.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Bill. I do require all employees that come in contact with our customers to wear a face covering. I have continued to enforce this requirement and address non-compliance immediately. I have installed cameras throughout the restaurant and check in multiple times a day when I am not on site. We also check the temperature of each and every employee every day when they come in and have greatly increased sanitizing the dining room and kitchen on a consistent basis with quaternary ammonia sanitizer. Our last health inspection score was a 96. I hope this helps ease your mind. I appreciate your business and invite you to give us another try. - Allen Folse, owner

name: Adam Dover
text:
I have been to three HH's since moving to the area two years ago and this is by far leaps and bounds the best one.  The staff really makes it good.  Granted the building is in slight decay and food (though solid for fast food) won't win any food critic awards, you feel like you in a very loose, friendly laid back environment.  You see a lot more personality from their workers and they almost always chat you up about completely random things just to kill time if it is slow there.

But my favorite thing about this place is it serves your dogs (pets) bones at the drive thru.  One time they had ran out of bones so he came back with strips of bacon without me even asking.  Later found out you are not supposed to give dogs bacon....But there was no ill will there.

name: D M
text: I've given this cookout a chance on 3 separate occasions. I never leave negative google reviews but at this point I feel obligated to. On my first 2 visits to this cookout they manage to completely mess up both of my orders. On my 3rd visit I sat in the outside lane waiting to order but no one answered me through the speaker. I then pulled up to the window and asked if the outside lane speaker works and the employee told me no it did not. I asked why was there no sign on the speaker indicating this or why was the lane not blocked off. At this point there was already a line of cars waiting behind me attempting to order in the outside Lane. The worker then had the audacity to ask me if I would personally go tell the other cars waiting behind me that they would have to pull into the inside lane if they wanted to order. After all of that they did not let me place an order at the window and then told me I would have to drive around and get back in the one functioning lane. I promptly said no thank you and left. Honestly, if I could give this place negative 5 stars I would. It's a shame one of the only 2 cookouts in the area probably has the worst customer service I've ever seen in my life.

text: I gave 4 stars because you can't five 3.5. stars. They had wonderful customer service , was very accurate on order & very accommodating. Since being in business in our area for about 4 months, customer service & attitudes are awful. Food is great & very reasonably priced.

name: Bradley Gilbert
text:
God, where do i even begin.
First up, the "lady" taking our order in the drive-thru started asking for our order before we even pulled up all the way. I tried to yell out the window that we weren't even at the board yet because the person in front of us was not pulled up far enough. When we did finally get to the board she would ask if we were ready to order LITERALLY every 4 seconds.
Next, since it was our first time there (AND LAST) the order board was like reading hieroglyphics. there were so many things on the menu and none of them were set up in a way to where they made sense. The 2 Order takers took turns asking over and over and over again what our order was.
I did not get what I wanted and honestly I don't know what i wanted because I couldn't understand the order board while being berated by two order takers, rushing us through.
3rd... When we did get to the window to pay, the cashier was rude and cold and shoved our order at us without saying a word. I would have been offended but I could see on her face that she has a permanent attitude and will likely be nothing more than a cashier, ever. If she worked for me she would not even last 1 hour... And she would be gone with her nasty attitude and Lee Press-On Nails that were sharpened into long claws. Also, if you're going to hire someone that is the face of your business, choose one that has a smile on it.
4th....the  Hamburger was a bland. Boring. Forgetful. The cajun fries were cheap dime store crinkle cut Frozen "french fries", if you could call them that with a straight face.
The Banana Pudding milkshake was pretty damn good. Not the best I've ever had, but pretty damn good..... The "service" at this location, is pretty damn bad. We won't be back.

text:
Been eating cookout for a few years now and still wondering how we can eat so much for so less! Great food at incredibly low prices... what more do you want?
Their new Chorizo Quesadilla is amazing and the Cheese bites are just perfect.

name: Hewy NoSleep
text:
We tried it out for the first time today around 2pm. It had two thru lanes and both were full. It took around  8 minutes from the start  of the line until we got the food but wait was mainly due to people reading there very big menu and not due to waiting on food.

I did love the choices of options. I would recommend you view their menu online and decide what you want before you get there because you could become overwhelmed by choices if you see it for the first time.

We spent around 7 dollars each.  I got a drink, burger and dog. The other order was a chicken sandwich, slaw, onion rings and drink. The chicken patty was small and flat compared to other fast food. The slaw was in a small sauce cup and she only received three breaded onion rings. She said the taste was good but the potions small. My burger & dog were ballpark field quality in a good way. The taste was great and they were the perfect size. I also loved being able to customize what I wanted on both.

I saw they had a walk up window for orders as well in case you didn't want to wait in the drive thru line. I think if you want a chicken sandwich you may want to go somewhere that focuses on it but if you have people who want different things from Corndogs to BBQ to Shakes then this is the perfect one stop place to make everyone happy.

text: I have eaten at the one in Hattiesburg and the one in Tuscaloosa. Both were great. The one here in Birmingham does NOT measure up. I was in line for 50 minutes. That is not a typo. 50 minutes. I wanted to leave the line, but I was in the inside lane so I was trapped. By the time I finally got my food, the fries were completely cold. Fries should be the last thing that go in the bag, right before you give it to the guest. I guess they put them in there when I placed my order.  Terrible experience. Birmingham has a lot of places to eat. If Cook Out does not DRASTICALLY improve, it will be gone soon. Would give it zero stars if I could.

text: Glad Birmingham finally has a Cook Out.  I've been several times since opening on New Year's Day and the service has always been pretty quick considering the number of customers in line.  Only downside is the staff needs to be trained better with how much change to give back if paying with cash.  Paid with a $50 on one occasion for a $14 meal and only got back $6 in change and another time I could tell the worker at the window had no clue how much change to give back after paying for a $11 meal with a $20.

name: Brendan Borders
text:
For some reason, the service here is extremely slow. I've never seen anything like it. If you pull in at 5, you definitely aren't leaving the drive thru line till 530. The only reason why I give 2 stars instead of 1, is because the employees seem apologetic at the window.

I'm not one to complain, but MGMT needs to step in and figure out the problems with the drive thru, because at this point, its not fast food anymore.

name: Robbert Fairbrother
text: This place has good cheap eat almost stays opened twenty four hours and is always a lot of folks grabbing a bite to eat. However the star of the show in my opinion is their shakes. They have over forty shakes but my favorite it oreo mint and the egg nog shake. Thick using quality ingredients makes this the best shake in the area. What I really enjoy about this place is the service is fast and they even have two drive thru's. Always worth a return visit.

name: Darcy Moseley
text: I ordered a bacon cheeseburger, no pickles, with the rest of the works, fries, onion rings, coke. I liked everything except the fries. I'd rather have seasoned  crinkled fries. The taste of the regular fries was not tasty nor done all the way. The rest of the food was very hot and delicious.  The food stayed hot in the foil until I got home to Irondale. I loved how my burger was wrapped in foil not paper or a cardboard box, Like McDonald's. The lines were super long, got my order within 10 minutes after getting there. Those double lines are perfect in getting customers our food quickly.  I'm continuing going there. I hope one opens up in Birmingham so I don't have to go on a road trip to get my food. I  have NEVER heard of Cook Out Restaurant,  only the movie Cook Out with Rapper Eve. Didn't know it have a walk up window and the parking lot is super small.  When you build new eateries you know PEOPLE love to eat. Make the parking lot a lot bigger.

name: Mollie Kimbrough
text: If you have a large family or a college student and you need to eat good however your pockets low. This place is where you want to be. I have a large family and so I'm used to paying a large bill for us to have good food. This place actually made my mouth drop after getting the bill for my family; super low loved it.  Now the food was really good too; major plus. So just saying my family and I will be there very often.

The staff has been nothing short of outstanding since the grand opening. They have been very pleasant and efficient every time I’ve visited. They might give Chick Fil A some much needed competition with their customer service.

Now there's so much to choose from.  The burger n bacon wrap is too good.  The shake is very thick it's more like icecream.  Try it and put your own lunch together.

text: Everything is good. But just so slow even there are two service window . Especially lunch time 12-2pm. Staff are always friendly.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: Very pleased. Terrific, friendly, and fast service. Pricing is quite reasonable. I really like Cheerwine and you never see it on menus but it is here!  Burger was very good. When I unwrapped it from the foil, it looked like the picture. Cheese covered completely both patties but none was stuck on the wrapper as it would have been anywhere else. The onion slices were fresh and cut thickly. The pickles were delightful. They were rectangular had a great flavor and were not soggy — they had a nice little crunch to them. But the tomato!  It was so big that it also covered the whole sandwich and was clearly cut fresh.  I hope they always buy big tomatoes and that this is the way they always are. Fries and onion rings were both good. Hush puppies were not what we are used to in the South. Not bad but I won’t order again.  Plenty of them in the bag.  They were the size — and looked like — a cocktail weenie that had been battered and fried.  The result is a large surface area that is hard and barely any fluffy corn meal inside. I do highly recommend going here — especially when hungry late. I will certainly be back very soon!
